node.title: Jail for Melbourne man who flew around world to groom and abuse underage girls
node.alt: The exterior of a building that says county Court
node.description: The County Court heardÂ the 43-year-old groomed five vulnerable teenage girls online, with one victim saying the abuse has left her feeling "completely alone".
node.content:
["A 43-year-old man will spend at least six\u00a0years behind bars\u00a0after being convicted of grooming and sexually abusing teenage girls around the world, including a 14-year-old girl in regional Victoria.", "Luke Coughlan, from Melbourne,\u00a0has been convicted of 11\u00a0sexual abuse offences, including producing child abuse material and\u00a0grooming a child under the age of 16 for sexual conduct.", "The offences were committed in Australia and overseas between 2013 and\u00a02019.\u00a0", "While the charges relate to five victims, the court heard Coughlan's phone contained hundreds of images of other unidentified girls.\u00a0", "The County Court in Melbourne heard Coughlan approached his victims online\u00a0when they were as young as 13.", "He then struck up an online relationship with them, during\u00a0which he took\u00a0advantage of their vulnerabilities and groomed\u00a0them for sexual activity.\u00a0", "His first victim, who was based in the United States, was just 13 when he contacted her over online chat website Omegle in 2010.", "While talking to the girl over several years, he asked\u00a0her to perform sexual acts, which he recorded on his computer.", "", "
One of Coughlan's victims (not pictured) has spoken of the huge toll his offending has taken on her life.(AAP: Joe Castro)
", "The two engaged in BDSM and he directed her to engage in various sexual acts, while talking online, including inflicting pain on herself for his sexual gratification.\u00a0", "In 2013, when the girl was 17, he flew to the US and met up with her. They had\u00a0sex and\u00a0he recorded it.", "
Victim 'feels completely alone'
", "Coughlan started talking to his second victim in late 2016 when she was 13 years old.", "The court heard he took advantage of the teenager's\u00a0low self-esteem by\u00a0complimenting her and gaining her trust as they spoke\u00a0online \u2014 actions that were designed to groom\u00a0her for sexual abuse.", "In February 2017, when the girl was 14, Coughlan met her at a park in regional Victoria,\u00a0where he had sex with her in a motorhome.\u00a0", "Coughlan\u00a0went on to direct her to send him naked pictures of herself with derogatory slogans written on her body and pictures of her engaging in sexual activity.", "In a victim impact statement, the girl said her relationship with her mother had been significantly impacted and her relationship with her father had completely deteriorated as a result of the abuse.", "The court heard the girl requires\u00a0therapy and counselling and has moved out of home.", "She also said in a statement, that she often \"feels completely alone, very uncomfortable in her body\" and \"doesn\u2019t trust how she feels\".", "
Abuse\u00a0has\u00a0'catastrophic consequences'\u00a0\u00a0
", "Judge David Sexton said the offending must be seen as \"extremely serious sexual offending in connection with children\".\u00a0\u00a0", "He said Coughlan often went to considerable lengths to offend and said this type of offending often had \"long-lasting and catastrophic consequences\".", "The court heard that in one case, Coughlan flew to Western Australia and\u00a0tracked\u00a0down a girl via social media app\u00a0Snapchat's maps location feature after she attempted to stop their communications.", "He threatened to commit suicide in order to pressure the girl to resume contact with him.", "Coughlan was convicted of 11 charges,\u00a0including grooming a child under the age of 16 for sexual conduct and having sex with a minor.", "Coughlan was also convicted of using a carriage service to procure a minor for sexual activity and several charges relating to creating, producing, and possessing child abuse material.", "He has been sentenced to 9\u00a0years and 3 months in prison, with a non-parole period of 6 years."]
